P009711.project_name: Water Supply and Sewerage Project - Uttar Pradesh

keywords.cdata: access to safe water,access to safe water supplies,agricultural economy,annual rainfall,arid areas,augmentation,billing,Climatic conditions,collection systems,competitive bidding,Construction,cubic meter,cubic meters,distribution systems,drilling rigs,drought,Electricity,Environmental Health,groundwater,groundwater sources,hand pumps,investment program,irrigation,irrigation purposes,large towns,leak detection,least cost,local authorities,Local water,maintenance of water,municipal boundaries,open wells,operation of water supply,oxidation,oxidation ponds,piped water,population growth,population growth rate,provision of water,provision of water supply,Public Health,public utility,pumping,quality of water,quality water,regional water authorities,regulatory agency,rivers,rural sanitation,Rural Water,Rural Water Supply,safe water,safe water supply,sanitation systems,sewage,sewage disposal,sewage farms,sewage treatment,sewage treatment plants,sewage treatment works,Sewerage,Sewerage Sector,Sewerage Services,sewerage system,Sewerage Systems,sewers,standpipes,surface water,town,towns,untreated sewage,urban areas,urban growth,urban sewerage,urban water,urban water supply,waste,Water Authority,Water Board,Water Demand,water scarcity,water sources,water supplies,Water Supply,water supply system,water supply systems,water systems,water treatment,water treatment plants,water use,wells

project_abstract.cdata: The project would assist in the reorganization of the water supply and sewerage sector in the State of Uttar Pradesh, the construction of water supply schemes in selected rural areas suffering from hardship due to inadequate water supply, and the improvement of water supply and sewage systems in the five largest cities of the State ("the KAVAL towns").
